alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 6:02AM PDT until May 11 at 12:11AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... John Day River at Service Creek affecting Wheeler County. For the John Day River...including Service Creek...Moderate flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...John Day River at Service Creek. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM PDT Monday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM PDT Monday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 12.8 feet late this evening. It will then rise to 13.6 feet late tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage Thursday evening to 10.5 feet early Sunday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 01/17/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu John Day River Service Creek 11.5 13.3 Mon 5 am PDT 13.0 13.5 12.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
